title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 373-2.6 - Health screening
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 373-2.6 - Health screening

State Regulations

As part of the RMA program, a comprehensive health
screening may be provided to refugees, asylees and Cuban/Haitian entrants
without prior determination of their eligibility for RMA if the screening is
done during the first 90 days from the date of entry into the United States for
refugees and Cuban/Haitian entrants and from the date asylum is granted by INS
for asylees. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§§
373-2.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
